refnamediv.refpurpose: Display the output or error stream from a GRAM job

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &cmd; program is an internal interface used by the globus-job-get-output program to copy output back to a GASS server. This program is submitted via the globusrun command and executes globus-url-copy to transfer the data.

The invocation to this command is created in the RSL arguments by the globus-job-get-output program. The arguments are positional and may change in future releases. Their meaning is
GASS cache tag for the output file GRAM job id Stream to transfer (stdout or stderr) Number of lines to include (from the end of the file) for one time processing or no Number of lines to include (from the end of the file) for tail -f processing or literal no GASS server URL to send the data to

refsect1.title: Options
refsect1.para:
The full set of options to &cmd; are:
-help -h -usage Display a help message to standard output and exit.

refsect1.title: ENVIRONMENT
refsect1.para:
If the following variables affect the execution of &cmd;.
X509_USER_PROXY Path to proxy credential.
X509_CERT_DIR Path to trusted certificate directory.
